section.text: The name and address of the applicant (owner or driver), and if the applicant (owner or driver) be a corporation, a certified copy of the articles of incorporation.
The number of vehicles actually owned and the number of vehicles actually operated by such owner on the date of such application, if any;
The net worth of the applicant (owner) over and above all debts, judgments, claims and demands whatsoever;

Whether there are any unpaid or unbonded judgments of record against such owner, and if so, the title of all actions and the amount of all judgments unpaid or unbonded, and reference to the judgment docket and page where the judgment is recorded;
Whether there are any liens, mortgages, or other encumbrances on such taxicabs, and, if so, the amount and character thereof;
The experience of the applicant in the transportation of passengers for hire;

Criminal History Records Information obtained by the North Carolina Department of Justice or the Federal Bureau of Investigation shall be privileged information and shall be kept confidential and not disseminated outside the Raleigh Police Department. This information shall not be public record information as defined by Chapter 132 of the North Carolina General Statues;
Authority to conduct Criminal History Records Check is referenced with North Carolina General Statute 160A-304.
Any of the following information obtained from Criminal History Records shall be deemed sufficient for refusing to issue a permit or for revoking a permit already issued:

The applicant shall from time to time furnish to the Council such other information as the Council, in its discretion, may require. (Code 1959 , §22-28; Ord. No. 1988-220, §2, 7-19-88; Ord. No. 2009-671, §§24—26, 11-3-09; Ord. No. 2009-672, §1, 11-3-09)
